metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3700 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in usbredir in versions prior to0.11.0 in the usbredirparser_serialize() inusbredirparser/usbredirparser.c. This issue occurs when serializing largeamounts of buffered write data in the case of a slow or blockeddestination.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libusbredirhost1 - 0.8.0-1ubuntu0.1
libusbredirparser1 - 0.8.0-1ubuntu0.1
usbredirserver - 0.8.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: usbredir package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.0-1ubuntu0.1').
